title: Were midwives encouraged in the United Kingdom to say "food " to become more inclusive?
subtitle: Adding new words is not like removing old words.
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: The maternity department of a hospital in the United Kingdom announced in February 2021 that it had been expanding the terms it used in maternity care to include, for example, "nutrition" and "carriers," in order to be more inclusive of cross-border and non-cohabited patients.
